reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Emergency provision of life saving WASH services in Eastern Ghouta

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide life-saving WASH services to under-served, previously hard-to-reach and forgotten areas in Eastern Ghouta. It aims in particular at providing safe drinking water to populations facing health and sanitary risks due to the lack of clean sources thus resort to alternative unsafe water sources. The hereby presented project is being coordinated with SARC, ICRC,DRC OXFAM and DAWSA. The planned actions are parts of a sustainable strategy which would enable eventually the DAWSA to manage the water network. ICRC is already conducting trainings and capacity building among SARC and DAWSA team and will rehabilitate part of the network in the comings months. TGH and its partners will also support DAWSA regarding its WASH and rehabilitation activities through the submission of project proposals to ECHO allocation and OCHA 2018 or 2019 allocation. TGH will implement water trucking activity while their coordinated actions with its partners will enable boreholes rehabilitation activities and water network rehabilitation and connexion. Indeed, TGH water trucking action aims at providing access to 10 liter of water per person per day to vulnerable conflict affected population in the following locations: - In Arbin Sub- district ( Zamalika and Arbin), TGH is ensuring to 57 000 individuals, 10 liter per person per day through the activity of water trucking. - In Kafr Batna sub-district ( Mahmadyieh , Jisreen, Hezzeh, Kafr Batna, Ein Terma, Saqba) where the damages rates range from 25 – 50%, with peaks to nearly 75% in Hezzeh, TGH is filling every day 36 tanks of 5m3 to reach the 157 m3 and cover all villages. The most rural location depends totally on the water delivered by TGH through water trucking. -In Harasta sub-district ( Modira, Misraba, Harasta), 75% of the building have suffered severe damages due to the conflict and no suitable water for drinking is available yet. In this context, TGH ensure the access of 194 m3 of drinkable water per day. -In Maliha subdtrict ( Deir Elasafir, Hatita Al jarash, Hteiteit elturkman), Duma sub-district (Hosh Eldawahreh) and in Nashabiyeh (Otaya, Qasemiyeh, jarba, Zamaniyeh). Those three sub-district don’t have functional boreholes and existing alternative sources of water are unsafe and their use must be limited to other purposes than drinking. Hence, TGH is providing 106 m3 per day to those three locations. -In Adra ( Electricity complex and Al Nasser collective shelter) where 2500 people are still living.
